title: Highest Persistence to Grade 5 for Males
description: In 2020, Chile achieved a 100% persistence rate for males reaching grade 5, indicating that all male students in the cohort continued their education to this level.

title: Highest Persistence to Last Grade of Primary for Males
description: In 2020, Chile had a 100% persistence rate for males reaching the last grade of primary school, showing that all male students in the cohort completed their primary education.

title: Lowest Percentage of Adolescents Out of School (Male)
description: In 2022, only 0.11% of male adolescents of lower secondary school age were out of school in Chile, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Lowest Proportion of Population Pushed Below Poverty Line by Health Expenditure
description: In 2016, only 0.01% of Chile's population was pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses, indicating strong financial protection in health care.

title: Lowest Net Official Flows from UNFPA
description: In 2017, Chile received $147,774 in net official flows from UNFPA, one of the lowest amounts globally.
